name: Kiss's Gene Simmons Quiz | Music | 20 Questions

questions.text: Where was Gene Simmons born?
questions.explanation:
Haifa, Israel.

	Gene was born on August 25, 1949.

questions.text: Eugene Simmons was his given name.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He was born Chaim Witz.  Chaim is a Hebrew name that means life.

questions.text: How many full siblings did Gene have?
questions.explanation:
0.

	Gene was an only child, though he has half siblings through his father.

questions.text: How old was Gene when he and his mother moved to the United States?
questions.explanation:
8.

	When they got to the US the went to live with his Uncle Larry in Queens.

questions.text: What job did Gene Simmons hold while he was in college at Sullivan County Community College?
questions.explanation:
lifeguard.

	He was a lifeguard at the Pines Hotel during the summer.

questions.text: What year did Gene Simmons meet Paul Stanley?
questions.explanation:
1970.

	Paul Stanley's given name was Stanley Eisen.

questions.text: When Gene and Paul first met they instantly became friends?
questions.explanation:
False.

	This is a quote from Gene Simmons about when they first met, "The truth of the matter is when we first met in upstate New York, Paul didn't like me at all.  He thought I was abrasive."

questions.text: Who wrote the song "Deuce"?
questions.explanation:
Gene Simmons.

	Gene Simmons was more interested in writing the songs than in playing any instrument.

questions.text: Who wrote the song "Strutter"?
questions.explanation:
Gene and Paul.

	Throughout their career several songs were a combined effort of Gene and Paul.

questions.text: How did Gene and Paul find Peter Criss?
questions.correct: An ad in "Rolling Stone" that Peter had placed
options: An ad in "Rolling Stone" that Gene had placed
questions.explanation:
An ad in "Rolling Stone" that Peter had placed.

	Peter's ad had said, "Drummer available-will do anything."

questions.text: What was Ace Frehley's given name?
questions.explanation:
Paul Frehley.

	They couldn't have two Pauls in the band so Ace said, "Just call me Ace."

questions.text: Gene Simmons was a heavy drinker?
questions.explanation:
False.

	According to his book, Gene has never been drunk.  He is straight, no drugs or alcohol and always has been.

questions.text: Gene was the assistant to the editor of which magazine?
questions.explanation:
Vogue.

	He also worked for 'Glamour' before moving to 'Vogue'.

questions.text: Did he change his name from Chaim Witz directly to Gene Simmons?
questions.explanation:
No.

	First he changed his name to Gene Klein, then he changed it to Gene Simmons.

questions.text: Gene Simmons was born into which religion?
questions.explanation:
Jewish.

	Gene was born into a Jewish family.

questions.text: When was the first KISS album recorded?
questions.explanation:
1973.

	The first KISS album was recorded in the fall of 1973 at Bell Sound Studios in New York City, and was released in 1974.

questions.text: In February 1974, KISS went on their first tour, where was it?
questions.explanation:
Canada.

	They were a last minute replacement for the 'Michael Quatro Band'.

questions.text: How many children does Gene Simmons have?
questions.explanation:
2.

	A boy Nicholas and a girl Sophie.

questions.text: Who is the mother of his children?
questions.explanation:
Shannon Tweed.

	He did have relationships with Cher and Diana, but did not have children with them.  Flora Witz is his mother.
